sentences: He is known for composing music scores for independent movies such as Kaboom, Highway, and the Peabody-winning American Revolutionary: The Evolution of Grace Lee Boggs, as well as for silent film restorations for Turner Classic Movies, including a 90-minute score for the Greta Garbo film The Mysterious Lady (2002).
He is a Sundance Lab Fellow  for film composition, and has had work premiere at the Cannes, Toronto, Berlin, and Sundance film festivals.
Maddala has received five Daytime Emmy nominations, with four wins, in the category of "Outstanding Music Direction and Composition."
